page.title: 04Small shops in SE Derby
page.content: True corner shops are becoming rarer in this part of Derby as they are forced to close by economic pressures. Better corner shops have attracted other shops to form small centres. These smaller centres are still dominated by the food and convenience shops, although Post Offices are a common addition. Each old village and new housing development has its parade of shops. The old swallowed-up villages such as Chellaston and Boulton used converted houses whilst new developments have custom-made premises, usually comprising a row of six shops, a supermarket and a public house. It is noticeable at present that the shops on the new estates are slow to be taken up, reflecting the lag between housing development and service provision.
